Ingredients.2: 1 sleeve buttery round crackers (such as Ritz®), crushed

Ingredients.4: 1 teaspoon poppy seeds, or more if desired

Ingredients.5: 1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of chicken soup

Directions.1: Place chicken breasts into a large pot; cover with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 20 minutes. Drain; shred chicken with two forks.

Directions.2: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix crackers, melted butter, and poppy seeds together in a large bowl until combined; set aside.

Directions.3: Stir condensed soup and sour cream together in a medium bowl; pour 1/2 of the mixture into a 9-nch square baking dish. Add shredded chicken in an even layer; top with remaining soup mixture. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese, then top with cracker mixture.

Directions.4: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese has melted and the sauce is bubbly, 25 to 30 minutes.
